events.name: The Navajo Witch Trials of 1878 with Karl Kasarda
events.description: It is 1878. Apache and Navajo peoples are rounded up and sent on a forced march east to  what can only be called a death camp at Bosque Redondo, NM.  Navajo survivors were eventually let free due to environmental conditions even the oppressors could no longer accept.   After a slow and dangerous death trek home they turned their ire on themselves.  The horror of what happened was blamed not on white colonizers, but on witches in their own community who brought this suffering upon them due to their evil ways. This is the Navajo Witch Purge of 1878.

events.name: What is Grey Faction? with Lucien Greaves
events.description: Lucien Greaves, co-founder of The Satanic Temple describes the history and mission of one of the oldest campaigns of The Satanic Temple, Grey Faction.

events.name: Is QAnon a religious cult? with Joseph Laycock
events.description: This is a presentation on using the field of new religious movements to analyze QAnon.

events.name: How Disinformation and Conspiracies in America Affect BIPOCs and their Religious Identity with the Satanists of Color Coalition
events.description: A panel discussion with the Satanists of Color Coalition
